intro: Gonostemon similis, commonly known as the Mexican nettle, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, alternate leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
